prompt_init: You will receive a text. Your task is to create a new original text by taking inspiration from this text. Juste output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text: One night two young men from Egulac went down to the river to hunt seals and while they were there it became foggy and calm. Then they heard war-cries, and they thought: 'Maybe this is a war-party'. They escaped to the shore, and hid behind a log. Now canoes came up, and they heard the noise of paddles, and saw one canoe coming up to them. There were five men in the canoe, and they said: 'What do you think? We wish to take you along. We are going up the river to make war on the people.' One of the young men said,'I have no arrows.' 'Arrows are in the canoe,' they said. 'I will not go along. I might be killed. My relatives do not know where I have gone. But you,' he said, turning to the other, 'may go with them.' So one of the young men went, but the other returned home. And the warriors went on up the river to a town on the other side of Kalama. The people came down to the water and they began to fight, and many were killed. But presently the young man heard one of the warriors say, 'Quick, let us go home: that Indian has been hit.' Now he thought: 'Oh, they are ghosts.' He did not feel sick, but they said he had been shot. So the canoes went back to Egulac and the young man went ashore to his house and made a fire. And he told everybody and said: 'Behold I accompanied the ghosts, and we went to fight. Many of our fellows were killed, and many of those who attacked us were killed. They said I was hit, and I did not feel sick.' He told it all, and then he became quiet. When the sun rose he fell down. Something black came out of his mouth. His face became contorted. The people jumped up and cried.He was dead.

In the stillness of the night, two brothers from the village of Ezuka decided to venture to the riverbank to set traps for the elusive marlin. Suddenly, the calmness was broken by the sound of distant drumming, causing the brothers to freeze. "Perhaps it's a celebration," one brother suggested, but the other was not convinced. The rhythm of the drums grew louder as the faint glow of torches appeared through the thick fog. The brothers knew they had to hide and quickly found refuge behind a large boulder.

A flotilla of boats emerged from the mist, their oars slicing through the water in unison. In one of the boats, five figures, clad in leaves and feathers, whispered to each other. "Friends, we have traveled far and seek your assistance," one of them called out. "Join us as we row to the neighboring village to exchange gifts and share stories."

The younger brother hesitated. "I don't have anything to offer. I didn't bring any gifts." Sensing his hesitation, the visitors assured him, "Worry not, for we carry gifts aplenty. You will be welcomed with open arms."

Despite his brother's unease, the elder agreed to join the visitors on their journey. As the flotilla departed, the remaining brother returns home, uneasy about the outcome of this spontaneous encounter.

Hours passed, and the younger brother participated in a night of feasting and storytelling. Yet, as dawn approached, he noticed something peculiar. One of the visitors, seemingly healthy only moments earlier, suddenly clutched his chest and collapsed. The celebratory atmosphere turned somber, and the brothers watched in horror as the stranger's face contorted, and black liquid poured from his mouth. The young man quickly rowed back to his village, filled with dread.

Upon arriving home, he recounted the tale to his fellow villagers, his words tripping over themselves as he struggled to explain the inexplicable. As he finished his harrowing account, he stumbled, falling to the ground. Those surrounding him leapt back in terror as a dark pool expanded beneath him, claiming another soul.
